ἐπίληπτ-ος,
Ionic dialect ἐπίλαμπτος, ον, caught or detected in anything, ἐ. ᾑρέθη 5th c.BC: Sophocles Tragicus “Antigone” 406: c.participle, ἐπίλαμπτος ἀφάσσουσα caught in the act of feeling, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2. culpable, censurable, πάθος [Refs 1st c.AD+]; of errors in metre, [Refs]
__3. disabled, ἀνδράποδον [Refs 4th c.BC+]; of a hen-partridge, [Refs]
__II. suffering from epilepsy, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; so ἐ. ὑπὸ πάθους 1st-2nd c.AD: Plutarchus Biographus et Philosophus 2.798f.
